newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-News Corp dips on U.S. downgrade.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-News Corp dips on U.S. downgrade.

text.p: Shares in media magnate Rupert Murdoch's News Corporation Ltd dipped over two percent to an intraday low of A$7.22 in early trade following following a downgrade by a U.S. stockbroker.
Paine Webber said on Monday it had cut its rating on the company to attractive from a buy.
"News is down on the back of the downgrade in the States and that is impacting the market," said dealer Brett O'Donovan of Lance Jones.
Others agreed, although they noted that volumes were not exceptionally heavy.
"Its ADRs were off and it has seen some selling here after the U.S. downgrade but volumes are not exciting," said a Sydney-based dealer.
By 11.50 a.m. (0150 GMT), News Corp shares were 12 cents lower at A$7.25 on turnover of 1.6 million shares.
